str2: And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: From peri and ballo; to throw all around, i.e. Invest.
Purple. From porphura; purpureal, i.e. Bluish red.
And, even, also, namely.
Crimson, scarlet, dyed with Kermes (coccum), the female coccus of the Kermes oak. From kokkos; crimson-colored.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: To gild, adorn with gold. From chrusos; to gild, i.e. Bespangle with golden ornaments.
A piece of gold, golden ornament. Diminutive of chrusos; a golden article, i.e. Gold plating, ornament, or coin.
And, even, also, namely.
Of great price, precious, honored.
A stone; met: of Jesus as the chief stone in a building. Apparently a primary word; a stone.
And, even, also, namely.
A pearl. From margaros; a pearl.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A hand.
Golden, made of gold, adorned with gold. From chrusos; made of gold.
A drinking cup, the contents of the cup; fig: the portion which God allots.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: To be full of. A primary verb; to swell out, i.e. Be full.
An abominable thing, an accursed thing. From bdelusso; a detestation, i.e. idolatry.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Unclean, impure. Impure (lewd) or specially, (demonic).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Fornication, whoredom; met: idolatry. From porneuo; harlotry; figuratively, idolatry.
